item.title: Bind the Caps Lock to the Control key in macOS
item.description: Do you ever use the Caps Lock key? I bet you ignore this nice button and don't use it at all, unless you write on COBOL or FORTRAN. This button is located on one of the most used keyboard lines and your little finger is almost always above this place. But you never press it. Fortunately we can change the action of this button and you are able to bind the action that you often use in your daily routine.

item.title: Monitoring Memory Usage From Ruby Process
item.description: Just put this in your code. You may use logger instead of puts. Thread.new do while true pid = Process.pid rss = `ps -eo pid,rss | grep #{pid}| awk '{print $2}'`.to_i puts "MEMORY[#{pid}]: rss: #{rss}, live objects #{GC.stat[:heap_live_slots]}" sleep 5 end end

item.title: Import Existing Vbox in Vagrant
item.description: # Add vbox to VirtualBox (Machine -> Add) # Then create a directories for Vagrant in the your project: cd project_directory mkdir -p .vagrant/machines/default/virtualbox VBoxManage list vms # copy a hash in curly braces of your vbox, ex. ‚Äúbdff668b-af18-4dad-ac58-9d9c1865d9d7‚Äù echo -n "COPIED_HASH" > .vagrant/machines/default/virtualbox/id # run VirtualBox and start your vbox, log in there with username: vagrant, password: vagrant cd ~ curl https://raw.githubusercontent.com/mitchellh/vagrant/master/keys/vagrant.pub >> .ssh/authorized_keys # After that you must logout from vbox and quit VirtualBox vagrant reload
